attributes.action: Abolish wheel clamping in England and Wales as it has been in Scotland and prevent the abuse of our human rights
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Wheel clamping of private vehicles is an abuse of our human rights to go about our business unhindered. It is right to fine people who park their vehicles inconsiderately on private land. However wheel clamping is a form of extortion and the costs of release are also extortinate and seemingly unregulated to the point that release fees can vary from £125 upto nearly £1000. This leads to unscrepulous firms effectively holding people to ransom. Not wheel clamping works fine in Scotland bring the rest of the UK up to their high standards of human rights protection

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Abolish wheel clamping in England and Wales as it has been in Scotland and prevent the abuse of our human rights."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22520


Prime Minister's Office
